review: The margaritas as usual where good and the molton cake, damn.  I will eat one right now.  This chilis bar area is really small, they have very few big tables (for 8 or more).  We waited more than an hour for our table.

Conveniently located near the 528 heading to the Orlando Int'l Airport.  After a really disappointing dining experience-or lack of, our party of 3 ventured into the familiar world of Chili's.  Since we were pressed for time and trying to not freeze under the vents in the booths, we sat in the bar area.  April, our server, was efficient, friendly and attentive to our dining experience. We started off with the complimentary salsa and chips and then went right in with the 1/2 rack of ribs. I enjoyed the memphis dry rub.. gives a different taste but in a good way!  Plenty of tvs around to watch your sporting preference, we sat in an optimal place to view the b-ball game, golf and crossfit training tournaments.  Prices are standard. $10 for 1/2 a rack of ribs and fries. Great happy hour specials available all day as well.

The existing 3-star reviews are probably the most accurate. I sometimes come here when I am near the airport and have to wait for a while for someone I'm picking up at the airport to arrive or if I have time to kill while waiting to depart. It isn't my favorite Chili's by any means. I have been to some that I have really liked and some that are average. This one falls into the latter category. The employees here were very nice during my most recent visit, which was this past Friday. I had a Presidente margarita and Texas-style French fries (with cheese, peppers, etc.) and hung out at the bar for about half an hour. Both the drink and food were good and I was treated very pleasantly. The atmosphere in here was a little bit weird, though. I was in here between maybe 2:15-2:45 on Friday and it was a little hectic and crazy inside. The group sitting behind me at the stand-alone bar table was very rowdy and loud, and I'm unsure what they were doing acting that way at that time and on a weekday. It was reminiscent of what some groups of people do in downtown Orlando on Fri./Sat. nights. They definitely were partying and carrying on, though it wasn't anything overly inappropriate (i.e. no bad language, etc.). I just wasn't expecting for such a wild celebration to be taking place at that time on a weekday (yes, it was a Fri., so maybe they got out of work early and got their weekend started before many others did). Oh, well. Maybe I just felt weird about it because I was tired, drove all the way to the area without my air conditioning working and the person who I was picking up at the airport had their flight delayed. Anyway, I'm sure that many people will find this Chili's to be much like many of the others, though I just don't like it as much as a few others I've been to. And, of course, I wouldn't go to it unless I was going to the airport before/after or just happened to be near it. (I live in College Park.) Overall, it is what it is. Of course, it always is nice to have 2-for-1s for many alcoholic drinks all day, every day ... but that's at (as far as I can tell) every Chili's, so there isn't a whole lot separating this one from the others. The ones in Alt. Springs and Lake Mary are the ones I've been to the most and are, in my opinion, nicer and the ones I'm much more likely to regularly return to.
Nice late night menu, great for post flight dining at MCO! The 2-for-1 all night happy hours in the bar are why I keep going back, you just can't beat it.

Never been disappointed in Chili's - their portions are kinda large, the food is tasty and my nephew loooves the honey chipotle chicken strips with fries and corn. He's 13 and eats like a man so if this can fill him up, you know it's a meal!
Over all good food. The server we had was great but it's only getting 2 stars because of the hair and glob of crap on one of my wifes forks :( Food was up to par though
Normal Chillis... This place does however become insanely crowded with long wait times. Nothing wrong with the restaurant, just long waits typically.

This Chili's at the airport is alright, first time I visited for a business lunch meeting. We didn't do official seating we sat at the bar, waitress was very friendly and super nice her name was Kelly so S/o's to her.. but sincerely the food was just ok. I had a like 4 long island ice teas so the bar tender did a great job on those. One thing we didn't like was the fact that they took all the coasters out and the tables are in tile so the waitress had to give us bar napkins for us to put our drinks on them because if not, it would've gotten our table all wet. So that was pretty lame, but all in all it was a pleasant experience. We ordered some chicken appetizer platter with southwestern egg rolls which are my favorite but the regular crisp chicken tenders  I do not recommend.  Batter was soggy and the chicken was chewy. The rest of the crispers were just fine.
Slow service. Smaller portions (the salads used to be huge). And overall just blah. Done eating here.

An exceptional Chili's! Fresh made chips and salsa on premises. Charming waitstaff, and generous whiskey pours - even during happy hour. Would come back here next time I'm waiting to get on a flight from MCO. 3 minutes from rental car dropoff, so ultra-convenient if you'd rather not wait/eat in the actual airport.

I had not been here in nearly forever.  It was a very busy night which equates to very loud inside.  I could barely hear our waiter much less anyone at our table.  I hope that couples weren't going for their first date, then again, it may incidentally lead to a second by default.  The food was decent and came out very quickly.  The service was decent too.  It is what I have come to expect from Chili's.

This was my first time having lunch at this specific Chili's and I must say that I was really looking forward to their fajita combo special that they've had on their menu for years.  I was so disappointed with the way they cooked both the chicken and the steak.  If it wasn't for us being engaged in a great dialogue together about what the future holds, I would've brought it up to the management team but the food was below average. The cooks may have had an off day or it may have been a new chef trying it out and he didn't cook it the way Chili's usually does so I may give them another chance the next time I'm staying in Orlando but I walked about annoyed. Their hostess wasn't the most pleasant person and I'm always confused when restaurants don't shop their own hostess to see how good of a job they do.  It's so difficult to judge a hostess based on an interview versus how they really treat people when they first arrive to your restaurant. Just like in sports I think she may have done better playing a different position such as a behind the scenes employee instead of the role she was playing. And out waitress needs to be reminded to smile more often.  Other than the the ice tea was great.

So on the last day of my Orlando vacation my boyfriend and I had practically empty wallets but still wanted to enjoy the end of our trip...we needed to refuel with lunch because we overslept and missed our hotel's complimentary breakfast and we had seen a commercial for Chili's the night before as we randomly caught up with Dexter, drank wine and ate cheese (I know, we're lushes). Now this Chili's commercial had said something about a $9.99 "Triple Dipper Meal" and my sweet prince decided that he needed that in his life sooner rather than later.  Surprise, there was a Chili's only a short drive from our hotel so the next day it had to happen. Obviously.  Upon entering we were seated immediately and our waiter gave us menus, introduced himself and went on to make some recommendations and get us drinks. Service throughout the rest of the meal was pretty great and even the manager stopped by at one point to see how we were doing. My boy went with his craving and went with the "Tripple Dipper" and I went for a lunch combo. ______________________________________________________________ The "Tripple Dipper" choices are pretty interesting and provide a variety of calorie-filled deliciously 'bad for you' treats! The options include:  +   Original Chicken Crispers (really they're fried/battered chicken tenders) +   Boneless Buffalo Wings  +   Boneless Honey-Chipotle Wings +   Southwestern Egg Rolls (they're filled with pepper, corn & other stuff I don't like) +   Big Mouth Bites (burger sliders, YUM!!) +   Hot Spinach & Artichoke Dip +   Loaded Potato Skins ______________________________________________________________ The options my beau went with were the original Chicken Crispers, boneless Buffalo Wings and the Southwestern Egg Rolls...ohhhhh how I yearned for Spinach & Artichoke Dip, lol - next time. He gave me a Chicken Cripser to try and it wasn't bad, but the meat to batter ratio was more off than I generally prefer. The meat was juicy and tasty but the batter was super greasy and not crunchy - these were actually better when microwaved as leftovers the next day, haha! I didn't try his other two selections because I don't handle spicy foods well. For my lunch I went with a lunch combo with comes with a soup and an entree. For the soup I chose the most ridiculous soup on their menu - the LOADED BAKED POTATO SOUP. It came topped with applewood smoked bacon, cheese, and fresh scallions. IT WAS AMAZING.  I'm also pretty sure it was the stuff heart attacks dream about and arteries have nightmares about - but it was an out of this world, delicious, buttery, creamy, potato laden, bacon lover's dream...also in that "this must be awful for you but I want to eat this every single, DAMN DAY" - kinda way. Yeah. My entree was their Bacon Ranch Chicken Quesadilla. It came stuffed with applewood smoked bacon, a pretty generous amount of deliciously seasoned & juicy as f@#! chicken, cheese and served with their signature dressing...which to me was a cross between chipotle mayo, Russian dressing with a touch of sour cream. In other words, delicious - it also came with french fries...with the potato skins on em, just the way I like it.  As far as drinky poos go, Chili's Happy Hour is 2-for-1 ALL DAY, EVERY DAY. The boy went with regular lime margaritas on the rocks with a salt rim and I went for raspberry margs with a sugary, red sugar rim. Both were refreshing, tasty and not too heavy on the sugary syrups - but neither packed a punch with the tequila content - BOOOOOOOOOO here. In all we were pleased with what we got for what we paid for and we ended up taking some back to the hotel fridge and enjoying it the next day. Chili's ended up being the gift that kept on giving, lol.

I like to go there for fundraiser meals.  I usually go every year in September for the St. Jude fundraiser where all the profits go to the charity.  I went there on the 11th for the fundraiser to benefit the Wounded Warrior Project.   I used to go to Chili's alot for their BOGO Margaritas and the two for $20 meals.  but the last few times I have been there, the Margarita are watery and the food quality suffers.

Went here on a Sunday because Chili's was participating in a "Project Wounded Warrior" donation event where a portion of profits go towards this effort. You really can't go wrong at Chili's.  I always enjoy their hamburgers, so good.  BOGO margarita's.  Tell me what's wrong with that.  The only complaint I have is noise.  Why does it have to be so noisy.  Other than that,  good experience.

Food was luke warm. Poor experience.  Two stars only because the waiter tried and we liked him.  Don't touch the display thingie on the table because whatever is says about being free, it is not, it ends up on the bill.

awesome experience. we went twice. great service and hot fresh food. Can't have better. We had: tropical sunrise, el nino, strawberry lemonade (was ok), flat bread, tacos, hot grilled plate, carribean salad, etc.
Great food. The ziosk at each table is a great idea.played games while waiting for food. We ordered the santa fe chicken salad and fajita trio and it was delicious.
This was a good spot for a quick lunch. Ordered the three-item Tex-Mex combo. Tostada, enchilada and soft taco. It was really tasty, the waiter was kind and the price was reasonable.

Always consistent so it gets 4 stars. The fajitas - sizzling goodness, the ribs - approved by my young man child, bacon burger- approved by the younger boy child, Top Shelf Margarita - mom approved! Server Joanna, attentive even though it was chaotic in the Saturday night.  Not long if a wait either for a Saturday, only about 15 minutes.

Came to this Chilis with a group of 4 for a going away party.  The drink specials were 2 for 1, which was a great deal.  For a starter ordered chips and guacamole, which was decent.  Unfortunately, they do not offer the free chips and salsa anymore unless you are sitting in the "lounge area."  My friend ordered buffalo sauce, which was not supposed to contain meat in the sauce, and it did.  We made the waitress aware, she brought her a new one and the manager took her entre off the bill.  I ordered the California chicken flatbread.  It wasn't bad, but was overloaded with ranch sauce.  I should have told them to leave the sauce on the side.  It was an ok experience.

This place is always filthy dirty and the staff is always too busy to care or pay attention to the guests. Or too busy on their cell phones or talking to each other to care about the guests I've been here 3 times now over 6 months and its always the same story. If this was an independent restaurant and not part of a chain with a good reputation, it would fail, even though its in the middle of hotel row by the airport. The Chili's brand is not well represented here.

I have been to other Chili's in the past and had mixed thoughts about the menu.  This time I got the chicken tacos and I was impressed.  They were very good, as was the mashed potatoes I got for a side.  The caesar salad was good, but I would pick something else next time.  The one thing Chili's does better than most is their online ordering.  It was very, very easy and they had a dedicated pick up counter staffed with friendly employees.  My hotel was right across the parking lot and this was a great choice to bring back to my room.  Make sure you try the watermelon lemonade, I have never seen it anywhere else and it was amazing!!!

We entered with a party of 6, the hostess does not even greet us just stares. He then sets a party of 3 at a table for 6 and then just hands us a beeper thing without telling us the wait time or anything. Service is absolutely terrible, the hostess has no social skills and no sense of urgency .

I give this place three stars because it is not as good as the Chili's in Vista, CA that I used to frequent but it is the best out of 4 I have eaten at since moving to Florida.  The chicken, steak, and shrimp fajitas and spinach artichoke dip is good.  I believe I may have heard the waitress say 2 for 1 drinks, which no Chili's I have been to offers.
The service at this location is terrible!!! During the weekend its the loudest, most obnoxious, kids screaming balloon popping place to be :( BLAH.
Monday @ happy hour. Skillet queso was piping hot and some chips were under cooked. The nachos were okay, the chips were tough to bite through. Service was on point.

Wow!  Stuck in the 90's??  First of all, I would like to say that I like Chili's and eat at them fairly often. I also travel a fair amount. When I went to search this particular one, I was surprised by the low star ratings of all of them in the area.  Maybe a district manager change is needed??  I also wanted to say that I just had a beer and left as the restaurant had two issues that I cannot deal with as a traveler. No cell service on T-Mobile and Verizon!  Seriously, you get no signal at an airport!  Next, no wifi!  What????  So, there is no possible way for me to stay in contact at a major airport with two different cell phones and several wifi devices, can't connect on anything??  Really??  A pico-cell site or repeater is cheap!  So I had one beer from a very nice bartender and went to an inferior restaurant to eat so that I can also do my job. How does something like this escape management?  Plain stupid this day and age, and very disappointing.

After waiting 10 mins just for our drinks we then waited over 30 mins for our food. Let me clarify that the restaurant was not busy when we got there. Our server was nowhere to be found so I asked the hostess for the manager to get an eta on our food. About 7 minutes later (and no manager visit) our Luke warm food was delivered. My fajitas weren't even sizzling and my husbands triple dipper was cold and greasy. After sitting there in awe for another five minutes our server finally noticed that we hadn't touched our food. At this point we had waited almost 15 mins for a manager and I asked again if he manager could come out without a 15 minute wait this time. When she finally came she made every excuse in the book and even said that she had personally cooked our food so there was no way it wasn't hot. After just saying we were going to leave she then apologized and told us she would replace our food. The second time out mine wasn't even correct. We just gave up because we had been there an hour already and wanted to go home. Horrible customer service and mediocre food at best. What a waste of my time.

The food here was simply delicious. Service was better expected.  They made a point to check-in consistently without being overbearing. Much better than I expected for a long popular chain restaurant.
It's your standard Chilis, but since it's Florida, the drink specials are good. They have a two for one happy hour, can't beat that.
The food is average chain food however the servers are awesome. At the end of the day it is all about the service
Service slow.  Food better at foodcourt. Ok of you are with kids.  I would suggest better options in airport.   Figured out later that gate terminal has restaurants as well.

I contacted this location because of a $200 plus charge to my CC and explained have never visited their location.  The manager was not helpful and stated someone probably ordered a to go. Really 200 plus worth of to go and that order wouldnt stand out.  Their CC processing company would not be available until Monday for them to look into it and they had to many orders to review or locate an order for 200.  I have eaten at Chilis in other locations but never again.  It is kinda of hard to spend 200 at Chilis.  It is not like dining at Ruth Chris.   So CC theft is an issue at this location when it's  management just puts it off on the cc company.  I had to shut down my CC and the company is sending me a new card. Chili's corp should really look into how the management handles CC fraud charge notifications. Update@ so I finally get a call back for some at Chilis management and they at like it is not a big deal.  Yes it is a hassle for you but really 8 out 10 times, Chilis will get paid out due to their merchant agreement, so what ls the big deal.  So I ask the rep for a copy of the receipt of the transaction and I am told no.  The rep says go ahead and file a police report and if  I file the police report  they will only give it to the investigator. if a report is ever looked into.  Really I am only a victim of CC theft for a short time ultimately it is really up to the CC company to file a ciminal complaint.   Great bussiness model Chilis!  I ask if they could perserve the video from that night of the 8 poeple dining on my cc and I am told the location has no video and most of their locations dont.  The Chili's rep stated cc theft happens all the time and it is what it is.  Of course he also shares it was a party of 8 people have drinks and food on a stolen cc. But really why should they care, the server was tipped and 8 out 10 times they get paid.

They were really hitting on all cylinders for lunch today. Had spicy shrimp tacos with black beans and rice.  The salsa is fantastic. Crazy fresh - this is a superior Chilis. Sat in the bar. Great service.
Horrible service. It's a "fast" food Mexican and they were inattentive and slow. Plus saw a last blow her nose and then you if food with no plastic gloves. No thank you.

Typical chilis. They have some new menu items with avocado which are pretty flavorful and decently priced. Our server was lively and very attentive. Although, he never brought us our appetizer hence the three stars. On the bright side he never charged us for it so we figured we saved a few bucks. Average Chilis = 3 Stars

Another perfect example of a place that's really better than 3-stars, but not quite four.  I sure would like to give it 3.5 - are you listening Yelp? Anyway, the fam and I visited here recently for my middle son's "Going Away Luncheon."  He's back to work from leave in the Army and returning to his next duty station in CA.  We all like Chili's and it was near the airport, so why not? As far as Chili's goes, it much like anyone one I've been too.  The service is good, if not spectacular, and the food is plentiful if not memorable.  The atmosphere during lunch is super relaxed, the place was very clean, and we had a great time, eating together as a family (all four grown kids and the wife) one last time.  No one was disappointed in their meal and it was so much some of the bigger eaters left stuff on the plate.   So why not four-stars?  Well...it's a Chili's, it's a big box that delivers decent food at a decent price, but there's no "Wow Factor" as I call it.  I'm not knocking them, I will return again and again.  It's just that the place doesn't tingle my toes, even though they do a really decent job.

Being coming here awhile and the service getting worse and worse. Especially curbside which at this Chilis is nonexistent.  Quality of the food is also going downhill . Sad since I've always been a fan of this chain but the service at this location is making me think twice about coming back

Stayed at a hotel nearby so decided to try this Chili's.  Watermelon margarita was really good but that is where it ended.  I had nachos which were limp, cold and overcooked.  My son had chicken strips which he did not like either.  My husband had a burger which was (surprise) overcooked.  Normally i would still tip the waitress well but she saw my barely touched plate and never even asked if everything was alright.  Seemed she was avoiding the obvious question.  Bad service/bad food.

Were generally happy with Chilis and know what to expect.   Unfortunately this location is an embarrassment to the chain.  Service is slow and inattentive, the restaurant is badly in need of an update and somehow the kitchen managed to ruin some of our regular favorites.  I would not recommend this particular location.

Ordered the new "Fresh Mex Pairings" where you can choose a 2 item or three item plate with two sides. It comes with rice and beans buy you can substitute them. I happened to choose a chicken taco, beef tostada, and chicken enchilada in green sauce. Out of the 3, the green enchilada was awesome, the chicken taco was good, but the beef tostada was a little salty. Great plate!

Service was good, but here's the lowdown on the food.....  Appetizers: The triple combo which included fried buffalo chicken wings, fried cheese chunks ( not sure of the official name, because they were just fried cheese chunks). The fried pickles were a greasy, soggy mess. They were not crunchy at all, even after removing the skin off the pickles, it didn't even have a crunch and we passed on those. The buffalo style chicken was your typical bar style buffalo chicken wings and the cheese chunks was decent. But I must warn you that the Chef must be obsessed with All spice AKA season salt aka Lawry's seasoning, because all three were garnished with it. Next, main dish: I got your everyday run of the mill bacon cheeseburger, with thick hearty bacon, overall I liked it. It came with french fries and you guessed it, all spice garnishing, plain and simple, it was good. In this case the seasoning was greatly appreciated. The wife got the Pick two mexican combo, substitute the rice and beans for house salad and french fries with chicken tostado and a chicken soft taco. I was told that the salad was a little wilted and a little bit too soft for her liking. She only ate the chicken taco, because the chicken tostado was overly garnished with the all spice so much,  that it has the possibility of shooting up your blood pressure. The french fries was very good though with the ranch dressing. Drinks: I'm usually a pina colada type guy, but they didn't have any, so I had to settle for a strawberry daiquiri, which was comped because it didn't taste good at all, it was very tart and that was even without the alcohol. Overall: Probably wont be in the Top 15, but if we don't have anything to do, we will be back.....
Worst service at any chilis I've been to, my party and I got up and left before we even ordered and never returned. And I love chilis.

Excellent service: I had the Ribeye which was perfectly seasoned and cooked exactly as i like it. Kudos to the chef. Only negative was the cold coffee, (I am a coffee junkie and I just hate lukewarm coffee) Overall a good experience, going option for dinner.

I would rather dine at a retirement community buffet. So terrible from start to finish. Poor service and overpriced microwaved food. My family and I kept hoping that we were on a terrible reality prank show because that's the only way we thought this experience could possibly be this bad.... Sadly, Ashton never showed up.
I'm not sure why this Chili's has such bad reviews. We are locals and every time we come here we have an amazing experience. The service and food is always on point.

There was a long black hair in my margarita mixer. It literally dangled out while I was pouring it into the glass. The guacamole wasn't mashed up or seasoned. The manager came by and asked if we were ok. -.-  that's all he did! I sent the drink back and the waitress brought me another shaker. I had to ask her to bring me a new glass too I told her I'm not drinking that !! Did she think I just wanted a free refill! No! The plates were dirty and the waitress never checked on us. I stopped eating chilis in lake Mary for dirty plates and flatware and now I am never eating here again either! Chilis' standards for cleanliness doesn't exist. This is the dirtiest chain of restaurants I have ever eaten at. Every time I come here it's something.

Quick and friendly service.  We did the 2 for 35$ deal.  I had the strawberry margarita n my husband had the regular margarita, we shared TX fries for the app., he had the ribs with mac n cheese and I had the 6oz steak with broccoli and loaded potatoes, we shared a hot brownie n ice cream desert.  Meat was tended n well seasoned.

I like this Chili's pretty well. I would give this a 3, but I'll bump it up because they have one of those dohickeys where you can pay at your table. That comes in handy for lunch breaks. I do like seeing what new specials they have each time I come here. Recently I had some really good wings. Hopefully they'll make them part of the regular menu.

If i could give them 0 stars i would.. We unfortunately were sat in the booth closest to the kitchen. The servers were screaming and singing loudly in the kitchen being completely disrespectful.. We waited forever to get our food and we could not complain to a manager because the manager was involved.. Never again will I come here and waste my time

This is by far the worst Chili's I have ever been to. All of wanted was a beer and something for dinner. I was in Orlando for business and chose this place because it was close to the hotel. First, every beer that I ordered, they were out of. I gave them four chances before I told them to forget it. I gave my order and asked that they not put Pico de Gallo on it, and guess what.....it was all over the place, inside and out. I sat next to the kitchen and the waitstaff was loud and obnoxious, not to mention the people a few tables down we were clearly drunk and so loud I could barely hear anything. I like chili's, but not this one.....there are several places to eat around here, go there....not here.

Had lunch with my son.  Arrived about 12:30 and waited for about 15 minutes (very busy) but there were a few tables not being utilized. I ordered prime rib tacos and my guest had the children's cheese burgers.  What I enjoyed about the visit: 1.  The hostess was very nice.  2.  The waitress was very good and pleasant.  3.  My prime rib taco was excellent.  4.  The waitress allowed us to eat at our own pace. We did not feel rushed.  I really wanted to give it a 4 or 5 stars, but had the following issues: 1.  I saw a lot of dust on the booths and between the booths. This is a sign that leaders of this restaurant do not value the importance of cleaning. (having a clean restaurant is the most important aspect for being in this industry) 2.  The food runner brought out wrong dish. The waitress quickly fixed the issue.

Sat at the bar. We got greeted pretty fast and ordered margaritas. The bartender was not attentive at all. I understand that the job is not easy but to have to ask for chips 3 times and get an attitude answer and then not get any plates for our apps was pretty much where we thought it was bad. The food was good. Probably won't come back to this location again.

I didn't expect much, it's Chilis after all...but I did expect to eat! We put our name on the wait and then ran to the bathroom. The place was FILTHY. The floors on the way to the bathroom were so dirty...chips, straws, napkins, everywhere. And then the bathroom. Let's just say I've been to cleaner gas station restrooms! It was absolutely disgusting. My husband tried to tell me the men's was worse. There's no way. Needless to say, we left.

Great 2-for-1 drink specials, but hate that they have to bring both at the same time! Wish they had more on their "healthy" menu or at least listed calories on all items! Hard to dine here without feeling bad about what I ate. :(  All in all, great service and decent menu if you don't mind indulging (or making it your only meal of the day)

Terrible worst food I have ever gotten from a Chili's thus far. Got the fajitas got the chicken and Carnitas. The pork was dry so dry it was uneatable and the chicken was barely warm. I told my server about this and all he said is " it is like that some times" lol and that's it. Would not recommend nor ever come back.

Went there a few weeks back with my husband and some friends and came out very disappointed, especially since we love Chili's and go to their restaurants all the time. We'd even dined at one not to long before that and our experience had been beyond superb, so what happened with this one? We'd never been to this location before but until this point, we believed every Chili's to be relatively the same, we decided to order two sirloins off the 2 for $20 menu like we ALWAYS do and were surprised when we were told that these did not come with a side, supposedly because they had to be prepared a certain way and so were only served with asparagus. (IT WAS NOT MADE CLEAR TO ME BY MY SERVER THAT THERE WERE TWO TYPES OF SIRLOIN, the other being the one I usually ordered.) So naturally I was confused, and oh so disappointed when my food arrived and I received a palm-sized portion of meat on top of some tiny cherry tomatoes and asparagus (which I did not eat). I had to order myself an extra side of mashed potatoes, and at that point, I was too disappointed to finish eating, as was my husband. We paid almost $40 for our meal and ended up having to order fast food on the way home... NEVER AGAIN.

When on Thursday June 2 72nd to celebrate my daughter's graduation and my other daughter sweet 16. AmyL was our waitress and was very nice and helpful. We where a group of 15 so we where a big group. She was always coming making sure we where ok or needed something else.. Kuddos to her for being so nice to my kids.

Friendly and attentive staff made of quick dinner after a day of traveling a very pleasant experience.  The standard Chili's fare was well prepared and quickly served.  The restaurant was clean and parking plentiful.

Ok, let me start by stating that our server Mario was great!! Thank You Mario!!! However the kitchen was bombing today. I have visited this location on numerous occasion. Our first dish that was sent back was under cooked cooled ribs. I mean iced cold!! Mario helped by getting the manager who when on and replace them. Our second dish to go back  was the 3 pairing and it was horrible. I was eating it because I was starving, till I made it to my Tostada... wow  smh ... it was stone cold in the middle. I flipped the avocado and it was rotten on the other side. Manager comes back and asked me if I wanted to replace the dish and I decided not to i was done. I was so done that I decided to just leave. I was comped 8 dollars. I wont even get in to my daughters dessert! I will never ever eat here again. I suggest everyone thinks twice!!!

My friend and I sat at the bar. I ordered house Rita and the first one when it came I said to my friend its not filled up (inch down from the top)she said well tell her to fill it up but I did not. I said will see what I get when I get my second one. Later she brought it and it was a about an inch from the top and asked the server how about filling the my drink to the top and she said she is not allowed to it is corporate s rule and if she did she could get fired. Ok then let me speak to the manager. Bar manager, Sheri came out and introduced herself and ask what was wrong. I showed her my drink that just came out. She then told me that the corporate  rule is that it is filled to the top of the handle. I said well its not even that its to the bottom of  the handle . She had the server put about two spoons in a salsa cup and put it in my glass. She said that's why you get 2 for 1. I feel insulated and don't want to go back to Chili s after that. I opened up today's paper and there is a Chili's ad in the Calendar section with a picture of a house Rita filled to the very top. I showed that to my friends today and can't believe Chili's. Very disappointing

I've gone to this place numerous amount of times went to take my daughter my wife out to dinner  I had a coupon for $10 off $30 purchase which expired 2 days ago I brought it up to the attention of the host before being seated he was very hospitable and said no worries I will have the manager come over and take care of that for you  I did tell him that I've been with Chili's for a long time receiving all these emails and stuff. When we got taken to our table the server came by three minutes later and after we spoke to him about it instead of calling the manager over obviously the host didn't explain anything to him and he went and was pretty much the messenger for the manager? Other than being brought the wrong dipping sauce for an appetizer I ordered for me and my wife, the meal was pretty good I'd had to say
Balloon popping baby screaming typical chilis. The place to go when you have to drag the kids out and they won't sit still. Blah.
It may be a chain but Roxy made it feel like home, great food and great service! Highly recommend!

This particular Chilis location was EXCELLENT! The Mix & Match Trio fajitas are TO DIE FOR! . . . Well, worth someone else dying for, that is; not myself, of course. Anyway, the entire experience was an absolute pleasure.

Okay Chilli's offers specials now and then. We came across one online where Chilli's was offering 3 course meal for only $10.00. So we go to this place here and first of all they don't even mention this special offer, your the one who has to bring it up. Second of all they tell you that they are out of the deserts offered on the fliers and that it be $2.00 more if you want desert. Hm who dumb is this? They don't have the deserts like cake but if you want it you got to pay $2.00 more. I think it's false advertisement on their part to offer a 3 course meal for $10.00 and when you get there they want to charge you $2.00 more for the desert.  We will never come to Chilli's again, they are slick people, geeze.

Honestly not one of the cleanest Chili's I have been to. Plus the last time I was there with a friend my friends meal had a huge hair in it. They replaced the food but I at least expected them to comp his food seeing fist it's just gross and second he had to wait even longer for food and by the time he got it I was already done. May never go back to this one!

We were seated promptly. Bar area was less noisy, server approached us in a timely manner. At 1st our server had a bit of attitude but we let it go, it made us feel not welcomed. On a personal note it was disturbing to see our server serve food with her 1 inch neon pink long nails. Not sanitary. No thank you or I'll be right back were heard from our server from the bar. Short and cut service. Our server picked up our dirty dishes while putting other dirty dishes on top of mine on our table. Very disgusting.  Food has a clumsy presentation, I guess someone slammed my dish somewhere cause I noticed a huge crack on my plate apart to the smeared food all over the edges of my plate. Didn't eat the food. Sent dish back, dish took too long to be remade so I cancelled it. Only good thing was the molten cake which was what brought us to this restaurant at first. As a customer I don't expect praise or smiles all day, efficiency and basic sanitary practice do it for me. Left 15% tip only.

Is good restaurant, excellent flavor, very friendly staff. I arrive at 11:00 AM No breakfast and the coffee is no good. Menu kids is poor, not to mauch for choose, regular menu is very good, no to spicy and good portions, price is accurate, the location is convenient, near to the airport MCO orlando, easy parking, restrooms are fairly clean.

I would have given a zero but it wouldn't let me so I had to give it a star. My husband and I went there last night and it wasn't that busy. We were seated for a good 20 minutes before a waitress finally showed up. We were able to get our order in after another 15 minutes looking at each other. She finally came back and took our order. The food came out all at once with the appetizers, salad and meal. I had a queso dip free from my reward but the manager didn't honor it, making up some excuse. The food was ok, not so impressed. We waited and never got a refill on our drinks and the check never came out until we asked for it. Overall this will be the last time I visit Chilli's. *  Sorry, It's the Winter Park location on  303 S. Semoran Blvd.  Winter Park, Fl. 32792

Chili's TOGO. We arrived in Orlando after 9 hours in the car and didn't want to sit in a loud restaurant (or any restaurant for that matter). My husband whipped out his phone, Googled Chili's and found this location close to the hotel. Parking lot was full, 'traunt was packed and loud, staff ran in and out of kitchen with no acknowledgement of me waiting to pick up food. Suddenly an angel emerged from the kitchen, floated in my direction and smiled. After asking my name and hitting a few keys on the register, she directed a young girl to retrieve my order. Before the girl could walk away a man stepped into her and asked for a TOGO order. The girl began asking him questions, but the angel intervened. In seconds I was standing there with my TOGO dinner and the man was calmly placing his order. If you go on a Friday, be patient because all of Orland will be there too! But my advice is order ahead and eat in the piece and quiet of a hotel room.

First, it's loud. And no napkins allowed on table BEFORE food is served. What?   Been an hour. No food. Got napkins. Bribed with a cheap-o appetizer. Still too loud.  Waiting for manager to appear. It's two days after St. Patrick's Day and they're still serving GREEN rice. Really?  Now we're arguing over the menu. Beans were a no-show.  Manager arrived and apologized all over himself. Bryan.  BTW. Manager confessed the meats in the bowls is frozen. THATS NOT FRESH.  Prime rib can not be served pink. Ours was black. And previously frozen.  We are local residents and don't want to return

First time here and it may be my last. We came for lunch and didn't get drinks until after the apps were served and when my food finally came  the chicken wasn't even hot the asparagus was raw and dry. The best part of my meal was the street corn. Our Server and didn't come check in us until time to pay.  Then when the check came I questioned why I was being charged separately for the sides he said it says the sides I chose said $1.00 more on the menu and I told him that is not what he told me when i asked if I had to have rice and beans. He told me I can choose any side. He looked at me walked away ripped up the receipt and left. His manager had to come take care of us and apologized and took care if the issue. It was extremely unprofessional.   Not a good first impression at all.

My boyfriend and I are regulars and sit at the bar and always get excellent service by Roxanna. She always greets us with a smile as we sit down, and knows our drink order by heart. You always see her treat all guests with respect. She's a good asset to the Chili's team; we come here for her :)

Me and my woman have been here at least 3 times before with no problems, but this time was different. There was an intense presence of flies. Just numerous flies flying around our meal and drinks. I don't take the time to come to a restaurant, eat INSIDE, and still have to deal with flies. It's highly unsatisfactory and unsanitary and unprofessional. It made us not want to eat as relaxed and leisurely as usual. This is by far my worst experience at any Chili's ever!

Went with friends last evening and I was very disappointed.   It was obvious that they were not prepared for a crowd.  The server seemed to constantly apologize.  I ordered crispers with corn on the cob and fries.  The crispers were warm at best.  The corn has no flavor and cold.  The fries were lukewarm.  The server took this off our bill.  One of our friends order was wrong missing the chicken.  The server had to take care of that.  I know that we will not be returning anytime soon, if ever.

(7/17/2017)  Got a pick up from the airport and this Chili's is on the right hand side of the road (going northbound), yeah, that's how we picked it.  It was late, but there were still a few folks, like maybe 2 other tables having dinner.  I was feeling super nauseous, having just stepped off  a plane, ordered a soup and salad combo.  House Salad was sufficient, a "side" salad, lettuce was a touch wilty around the edges, pieces kind of large and unwieldy.  I didn't touch the soup that night, but had it the next day for lunch  Was very thick and creamy, some hard bacon bits thrown in, rather cheesy (in a Velveeta sort of way, but that's not a bad thing).  Dining partner enjoyed the Honey-Chipotle Chicken Crispers (just a deep-friend tender, in case you were wondering) with a side of fries.  Waitress was very attentive at first, then disappeared halfway through.   As soon as went to talk to a manager about finding her (so we could get our check and leave), she popped up.  Table was dirty when we were sat by the host (he got an equally dirty wet rag to wipe it off).  It would suffice if you were stuck in the one of the hotels nearby.  There was a bar substantially full with people (they must've been one of the stuck ones).

Went to chilis 2 nights in a row. Tonight I ordered 2 grilled margarita chickens and a bacon cheeseburger. I waited about 30 minutes for the order to arrive. I brought all The food back to the hotel. Upon opening up the food ,my daughter in laws burger was some chicken and boneless wings app.  I walked back to chilis and handed the app to barmaid I said could I please get a burger instead of wings. A manager came over and said "I'm sorry about the mistake. She ordered a new burger and then dismissed me like a kid when she said "have a seat and we will bring you the food" so I sat by the bar for approximately 20 minutes when the barmaid brought my burger . She than said ,you can keep the  app as we will throw it out anyway. I told her I don't want the 1 hour old app. I told her that I m really taken back that the manager didn't offer a drink or refund of burger.  I will never go back to this chilis. This manager needs a lesson in good managing. It's not just the customers that scream the loudest, sometimes customers that should be compensated but don't make a big fuss are the ones that should be compensated the most. I urge all customers to check your order before you leave so this doesn't happen to you. And I hope the manager on duty " I think her name was Amy. Should get more training on how to be a competent manager.

Your typical chilis.. i mostly come here for the tostada chips and salsa .. the food is not all the great to me, its like another tgi fridays chain with kind of a different name The staff is friendly and seem knowledgable about the menu but when you order take out its like the kitchen staff walk past you without taking your order or telling someone to come help you .. they are not very observant or they can most likely just be ignoring their customers  The salsa that comes with the chips twice was kinda watered down and barley had any salsa in it.. too bad idk if i want to order from this location anymore

I'll give it three stars. Normally this location is very busy and an extreme wait. It must've been my lucky day when I went because it was slow, empty parking lot, and no wait (or so I thought).  My friend and I walked in and the host told us it would be just a second and she would get us seated... we sat there for ten minutes and watched her play on her phone. While we were wondering why we weren't being sat as there was SEVERAL open tables. Another group of three walked in and she told them the same story.. but they walked out and the host didn't even notice because she was on her phone. Eventually told us she was waiting for "more servers" but we saw several just standing around.  Eventually she did seat us, but seemed extremely annoyed finally after 10 minutes. Tyler was our server and  he was excellent. Very efficient, friendly, just all around a great server.  The food was good, but nothing I would rave about. I had the loaded potato soup, and buffalo ranch chicken sandwich. Mediocre at best.  Honestly, in the end Tyler saved the review.
